Package org.jlab.mya.stream

package org.jlab.mya.stream

Provides classes for wrapping streams.

Example 
         DataNexus nexus = new OnDemandNexus("ops");

         String pv = "R123PMES";
         Instant begin = TimeUtil.toLocalDT("2017-01-01T00:00:00.123456");
         Instant end = TimeUtil.toLocalDT("2017-01-01T00:01:00.123456");

         Metadata<FloatEvent> metadata = nexus.findMetadata(pv, FloatEvent.class);

         long count = nexus.count(metadata, begin, end);

         FloatEvent priorPoint = nexus.findEvent(metadata, begin);

         long bins = 10;
         short[] eventStatsMap = new short[]{RunningStatistics.INTEGRATION};

         try (
                 // Get stream of FloatEvents
                 final EventStream<FloatEvent> stream = nexus.openEventStream(metadata, begin, end);

                 // Ensure points exist on the interval boundaries
                 final BoundaryAwareStream<FloatEvent> boundaryStream = new BoundaryAwareStream<>(stream, begin, end, priorPoint, false, FloatEvent.class);

                 // Analyze the stream and integrate
                 final FloatAnalysisStream analysisStream = new FloatAnalysisStream(boundaryStream, eventStatsMap);

                 // Downsample the results for easy graphical display (such as on a web browser)
                 final FloatGraphicalSampleStream<AnalyzedFloatEvent> sampleStream = new FloatGraphicalSampleStream<>(analysisStream, bins, count, AnalyzedFloatEvent.class);
             ) {

             AnalyzedFloatEvent event;

             while ((event = sampleStream.read()) != null) {
                 System.out.println(event.toString(2) + ", integration: " + event.getEventStats()[0]);
             }

             RunningStatistics stats = analysisStream.getLatestStats();

             System.out.println("Max: " + stats.getMax());
             System.out.println("Min: " + stats.getMin());
             System.out.println("Mean: " + stats.getMean());
         }
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    org.jlab.mya
    Provides the core jmyapi classes.
    org.jlab.mya.event
    Provides the event classes.
    org.jlab.mya.nexus
    Provides the query service nexuses.
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    BoundaryAwareStream<T extends Event>
    A BoundaryAwareStream will attempt to provide an event (point) exactly on the beginning and end of an interval.
    EventStream<T extends Event>
    Provides an I/O Channel for streaming Mya events.
    FloatAnalysisStream
    Wraps an EventStream of FloatEvents and provides AnalyzedFloatEvents.
    FloatGraphicalSampleStream<T extends FloatEvent>
    Wraps an EventStream and provides FloatEvents that are down-sampled as they stream by using an algorithm which attempts to maintain graphical fidelity of the data.
    FloatSimpleSampleStream<T extends FloatEvent>
    Wraps an EventStream and provides FloatEvents that are down-sampled as they stream by using a simple algorithm.
    LabeledEnumStream
    Wraps an IntEventStream and provides LabelEnumEvents by assigning enumeration labels to integer values.
    ListStream<T extends Event>
    An EventStream backed by an in-memory list.
    MySamplerStream<T extends Event>
    This is a class that attempts to mimic the commandline mySampler application.
    WrappedStream<T extends Event,E extends Event>
    An EventStream that wraps another EventStream.
